instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.AP_RESET_L: What is AP_RESET_L? AP_RESET_L resets the wifi hardware when it is low, which will keep it from working. AP_RESET_L needs to be high for reset to not be asserted.  _L means whatever before the _L in the signal name is asserted when it is low voltage, such as 0.0v to 0.5v..
definitions.AP_PWR_EN: What is AP_PWR_EN? AP_PWR_EN is a signal that enables power for the wifi circuit and wifi card. Signals with _EN on the end enable whatever came before the _EN if the signal is high. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no WIFI but have Bluetooth i change card but no luck
threads.message:
i change card but no luck
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S3</SIGNAL>   3.2V
<RESISTOR>R3451</RESISTOR> PIN 2 = 3.2V
<TRANSISTOR>Q3450</TRANSISTOR> PINS 1-4 =3.2V
PINS 5-8 = 0V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no WIFI but have Bluetooth i change card but no luck
threads.message:
Did you change the flex too?
Post <CHIP>U3440</CHIP> voltages.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no WIFI but have Bluetooth i change card but no luck
threads.message:
yes i change cable
<CHIP>U3440</CHIP> pin 1 <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S3</SIGNAL> = 3.2v
pin 2 = 0
pin3 <SIGNAL>AP_RESET_L</SIGNAL> = 3.3
pin 4 = 0
pin 6 <SIGNAL>AP_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> = 3.2v
everthing else = 0

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no WIFI but have Bluetooth i change card but no luck
threads.message:
Post <TRANSISTOR>Q7920</TRANSISTOR>/25 voltages.
Inspect that area for corrosion.
